If you’d like to know more about the role of the white team – the group of employees from within the company that organises the hack – have a look at our newly published TIBER-EU white team guidance https://t.co/8551xjURY3 https://t.co/uyT8E0Zn6N

Our TIBER-EU framework details how financial companies can test their cyber resilience. Ethical hackers (red team) attack a company (blue team); only a few employees within the company know it’s happening (white team) https://t.co/7DPPMQYv95 https://t.co/IA9FFZcnft
What is #ethicalhacking? And why do we encourage it? Watch to find out. https://t.co/k2IIM4AtlD

Draghi: The fascination with illiberal prescriptions and regimes is spreading; we are seeing little steps back in history. And this is why our European project is even more important today. Read the full speech here https://t.co/oaJKIdhnCc 9/9

Draghi: Each country has its own agenda for reform, but structural reforms are the only way to create the conditions for sustainable growth in wages, productivity and employment and to underpin our welfare state 8/9

Draghi: Several euro area countries have achieved significant convergence, particularly the Baltic countries, Slovakia, Malta and Slovenia. In these countries, the gap between real GDP per capita and the euro area mean has been reduced by around one-third since 1999 7/9

Draghi: We should consider what gains have been made as a result of having one market with one money. The euro has protected the Single Market and driven growing trade, with intra-EU exports rising from 13% to 20% of EU GDP since 1992 5/9

Draghi: Monetary Union has succeeded in many ways, but it has not delivered all the gains that were expected, partly because of domestic policy choices and partly because of the Monetary Union being incomplete 4/9
Draghi: Contrary to the wider process of globalisation, the Single Market has allowed Europe to impose its values on economic integration – to build as free and just a market as possible 3/9

Draghi: The Single Market is often seen simply as an expression of the globalisation process, which over time has even eliminated exchange rate flexibility. But the Single Market and globalisation are not the same thing. 2/9

(THREAD) Mario Draghi is speaking at the  School of Advanced Studies @SantAnnaPisa in Italy today. With the euro turning 20 soon, he looks back at the creation of the Single Market and its benefits. Read on to find out more. Full speech here https://t.co/oaJKIdhnCc #EUROat20 1/9 https://t.co/rKAyAhp4bM

Lautenschläger: In future banks might be allowed to use lower-quality capital to build up their Pillar 2 buffers. This is something we supervisors are not very keen on – banks would be less resilient, the playing field less even and the taxpayers less well-off.

Lautenschläger: The post-crisis reforms have helped to make the banking sector a safer place, but they still need to be finalised. The key point now is to implement the Basel III reforms, to turn them into actual law. https://t.co/WaTWLm9jie
Speech Sabine Lautenschläger: The banking sector – where did we end up after all the reforms? https://t.co/q8xRxk8cCc

ECB will directly supervise 119 banks in 2019 https://t.co/aPvLkuaNsB

ECB decides on technical parameters for the reinvestment of its asset purchase programme https://t.co/9UPBLeTABc

Draghi: I think the euro has been a success. Has everyone participated to this success? We have to ask why not. I would like candid, close introspection that could inspire future action on completing the monetary union.
Draghi: QE is part of our toolbox and can be considered to be useable by the Governing Council in contingencies. We’ve always considered this and it has now been sanctioned by the ECJ
Draghi: The purpose of a corporate purchase programme is not to minimise losses and maximise profits, it is for monetary policy purposes
Draghi: We have not discussed other tools of monetary policy, but general intention is to keep liquidity as available as it needs to be
Draghi: We welcome the steps that were taken by the euro group on improvement of monetary union, but it is clear that more needs to be done
Draghi: If there are negative effects on banks' profitability they are more than offset by other impacts on the balance sheet
Draghi: We didn't have to discuss restarting net asset purchases, because our base line is still valid
Draghi: At some points QE has been the only driver of this recovery
Draghi: Today's decision was unanimous
Draghi: We think we have instruments to address contingencies in this climate of great uncertainty, the monetary policy formulation wants to keep optionality as a dominant feature

Draghi: Redemptions will be reinvested in jurisdiction in which principal repayments are made, but portfolio allocation across jurisdictions will continue to be adjusted to bring share of the PSPP portfolio in closer alignment with ECB capital key
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/a3oRfrBhTA
Draghi introduces the GDP and inflation outlook for the euro area https://t.co/WwX68kvU41

Draghi: However, the balance of risks [to the growth outlook] is moving to the downside owing to the persistence of uncertainties related to geopolitical factors, the threat of protectionism, vulnerabilities in emerging markets and financial market volatility

Draghi: The Governing Council stands ready to adjust all of its instruments, as appropriate, to ensure that inflation continues to move towards the Governing Council’s inflation aim in a sustained manner

Draghi: Our forward guidance on the key ECB interest rates, reinforced by the reinvestments of the sizeable stock of acquired assets, continues to provide the necessary degree of monetary accommodation for the sustained convergence of inflation to our aim
Draghi: Significant monetary policy stimulus is still needed to support the further build-up of domestic price pressures and headline inflation developments over the medium term

Draghi: We intend to continue reinvesting, in full, the principal payments from maturing securities purchased under the APP for an extended period of time past the date when we start raising the key ECB interest rates, and in any case for as long as necessary
Draghi: The net purchases under the asset purchase programme (APP) will end in December 2018. At the same time, we are enhancing our forward guidance on reinvestment.

Draghi: We continue to expect the key ECB interest rates to remain at their present levels at least through the summer of 2019, and in any case for as long as necessary to ensure the continued sustained convergence of inflation to our aim over the medium term

Ask your bank if they’re using #TIPS! Connecting is free of charge and it costs them just €0.002 to complete a transfer (a fifth of a cent!) https://t.co/KXlqf4DEme https://t.co/csgl3B4myX

You told us that most of you still have to wait a day or more for a bank transfer to arrive. We’re changing that! Banks can now make use of our brand new service #TIPS to make your bank transfers immediate, anywhere in Europe. Find out more here https://t.co/KXlqf4DEme https://t.co/UA0Ocy7oBU
To reach sustainable levels of profitability, banks need to overcome some structural challenges https://t.co/Ow9xILmdJr 3/3 https://t.co/NMCMlQIsfX

Compared with some other countries, the profitability of banks in the euro area did not pick up as quickly for several years after the financial crisis and is still lower. But how profitable do banks need to be? https://t.co/e9x3kz2nbt 2/3 https://t.co/41XCcxfrUN

(THREAD) Continued low profitability in banks could raise funding costs, reduce lending to households and firms and dampen economic growth prospects. That’s why we consider it one of the key risks to financial stability in the euro area https://t.co/n1lYY8fTwZ 1/3 https://t.co/81Sio4KwLF

@AbbaXRPDavid Hi there, there is no link. TIPS is a service offered to banks by the Eurosystem. It's an extension to the RTGS system TARGET2 and will be monitored, funded and defunded via TARGET2.
@MichaelManfield Hi there, no, it does not. TIPS is a service offered to banks by the Eurosystem. It's an extension to the RTGS system TARGET2 and will be monitored, funded and defunded via TARGET2.
Find out more about the #TIPS launch in our press release https://t.co/5ixF2cQJl1 https://t.co/7v4WDSV7Fl
